meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sparse.
meanings.sent1: The sparsity of trees in the desert was striking.
meanings.sent2: The sparsity of furniture in the room made it feel spacious.
meanings.sent3: The sparsity of toppings on the pizza made it look like a plain pie.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, the sparsity of islands was noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The sparsity of stars in the cloudy sky made stargazing impossible.

meanings.sent1: She was disappointed by the sparsity of flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The sparsity of attendees at the event was unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The sparsity of chocolate chips in the cookie left her wanting more.
meanings.sent4: Among the vast book collection, the sparsity of mysteries stood out.
meanings.sent5: The sparsity of coins in his pocket made him realize he needed to visit the bank.
